clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Vibegron is indicated for the treatment of overactive bladder OAB with symptoms of urge urinary incontinence urgency and urinary frequency in adults L28305

contraindications.disease: There is limited clinical information on overdose from vibegron In the case of a suspected drug overdose supportive and symptomatic treatment should be initiated L28305
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Vibegron selectivity for beta 3 adrenergic receptors is 9000 times higher than for β1AR or β2AR A226065 Vibegron improves clinical symptoms of overactive bladder by increasing bladder capacity without affecting bladder contraction A226060 It significantly increases the functional bladder volume in a dose dependent manner which results in prolongation of the interval between voids In clinical studies vibegron inhibited detrusor bladder contractions in a concentration dependent manner reduced voiding pressure and increased bladder compliance A226065 In Japanese clinical studies comprising patients with overactive bladder vibegron significantly improved the frequency of micturition urgency and urgency incontinence episodes A226055 A226065

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Digoxin can be increased when it is combined with Vibegron
The serum concentration of Metildigoxin can be increased when it is combined with Vibegron
The serum concentration of Acetyldigoxin can be increased when it is combined with Vibegron
Trospium may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Darifenacin may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Tolterodine may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Oxybutynin may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Flavoxate may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Solifenacin may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Solabegron may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Fesoterodine may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Mirabegron may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Ritobegron may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Propiverine may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Meladrazine may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Emepronium may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
Terodiline may increase the smooth muscle relaxing activities of Vibegron
